intro: Loeflingia prostrata, commonly known as the prostrate loeflingia, is a low-growing, herbaceous plant native to specific regions of South America. It features small, elliptical leaves that are typically arranged in a basal rosette, contributing to its compact form. The plant produces tiny, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often in late spring or early summer. Its botanical structure is adapted to thrive in moist, shaded environments, making it a common sight in forest understories. Due to its delicate appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
